Expression classes

Contains classes for language-independent representation of expressions.

Summary
Expression classes
Contains classes for language-independent representation of expressions.

Expression

Base class for all expression nodes.

Summary
Functions
getPHP
Returns the expression represented in PHP.
getJS
Returns the expression represented in JavaScript.
getHTML
Returns the expression for use in HTML templates.

Functions

getPHP

abstract public function getPHP($indent)

Returns the expression represented in PHP.

Parameters

$indentThe current indentation string that should be concatenated after newlines.

Returns

A string representing the expression in PHP.

getJS

abstract public function getJS( $indent,
DescParser $parser)

Returns the expression represented in JavaScript.

Parameters

$indentThe current indentation string that should be concatenated after newlines.
$parserAn instance of DescParser.  In Javascript, some form elements are accessed in different ways, so the expression then needs to know its input type.  With a DescParser it can ask this information.

Returns

A string representing the expression in JavaScript.

getHTML

abstract public function getHTML()

Returns the expression for use in HTML templates.  Currently this uses Smarty syntax.

Returns

A string representing the expression for use in HTML templates.

GenericExpr

A generic expression container.  This node can be used for expressions that are fairly specific and it’s therefore not really convenient to write a new expression class for them.

Summary
Functions
__construct

Functions

__construct

public function __construct($phpFn,
$jsFn,
$htmlFn)

Parameters

$phpFnA callback to be called when a PHP representation is needed.
$jsFnA callback to be called when a Javascript representation is needed.
$htmlFnA callback to be called when a HTML template representation is needed.

The respective callbacks should accept the same parameters as Expression::getPHP, Expression::getJS and Expression::getHTML, and return the string representation.

ValueExpr

An expression that represents values.  Currently supports integers, floats and strings.

Summary
Functions
__construct

Functions

__construct

public function __construct($value)

Parameters

$valueThe value this expression contains.

ChildExpr

A base expression class for expressions that can have child nodes.

Summary
Functions
getChildren
Returns the children of this expression node.

Functions

getChildren

abstract public function getChildren()

Returns the children of this expression node.

Returns

An array of Expression nodes.

UnaryExpr

A class for unary operation expressions.

Summary
Functions
__construct

Functions

__construct

public function __construct( $op,
Expression $child)

Parameters

$opA string representing the operator.
$childThe expression the operator applies to.

BinaryExpr

A class for binary operation expressions.

Summary
Functions
__construct

Functions

__construct

public function __construct( $op,
Expression $left,
Expression $right)

Parameters

$opA string representing the operator.
$leftThe left-hand parameter of the operator.
$rightThe right-hand parameter of the operator.

BinaryExpr

A class for representing the ternary operator (?:).

Summary
Functions
__construct

Functions

__construct

public function __construct(Expression $guard,
Expression $iftrue,
Expression $iffalse)

Parameters

$guardThe expression that represents the test.
$iftrueThe expression to return if the guard is true.
$iffalseThe expression to return if the guard is false.

NaryExpr

A class for representing expressions with many children to which the same operator is applied.  If any given children are null, they will be left out of the final representation.

Summary
Functions
__construct
add
Adds a single expression to the end of the expression list.
addFirst
Adds a single expression to the beginning of the expression list.

Functions

__construct

public function __construct( $op,
array $exprs)

Parameters

$opA string representing the operator.
$exprsAn array of expressions that the operator applies to.

add

public function add(Expression $ex)

Adds a single expression to the end of the expression list.

Parameters

$exThe expression to add

addFirst

public function addFirst(Expression $ex)

Adds a single expression to the beginning of the expression list.

Parameters

$exThe expression to add

FormElExpr

Represents a form element.  This expression will translate into a piece of code that requests the value of the given form element.

Summary
Functions
__construct

Functions

__construct

public function __construct($name)

Parameters

$nameThe name of the element.

IsGivenExpr

An expression to check whether an expression is given.  Generally the child of this will be a FormElExpr.

Summary
Functions
__construct

Functions

__construct

public function __construct(Expression $child)

Parameters

$childThe expression to check.

IsGivenExpr

An expression to check whether an expression is set.  Generally the child of this will be a FormElExpr.

Note

Currently is undefined for JavaScript.

Summary
Functions
__construct

Functions

__construct

public function __construct(Expression $child)

Parameters

$childThe expression to check.

ValidEnumExpr

Checks whether an expression is within a specific set of values.

Note

Currently always returns true in javascript, since this expression tends to be used in dropdown, radio button, or similar controls.  These by definition fall into the valid values.

Summary
Functions
__construct

Functions

__construct

public function __construct(Expression $child,
array $values)

Parameters

$childThe expression to check.
$valuesAn array of values the expression may resolve to.

The form description parser.
Base class for all expression nodes.
Represents a form element.
